Still wondering whether I should change my suggestion
It's currently a lore thing, which I like...
But I kinda wanna do another RaineXRed pic...but maybe I do too many of those...
What suggestions're you all thinking of?
Here's one: Tom bumps into the TK cast while at a convention.
One reason I want to give Raine and Red a Break is that there's a user on Patreon and Deviantart who...really has it out for Red.
And there are two endings to this.
Tom asks how they did their costumes and things don't end well.
Some of the cast members "kidnap" Tom and make demands for some things.
Example: Flora wanting a big chest / Natani wanting to be a male ect. ect.
Mine's either going to stay as a lore sketch (Razing of Wreathwood)
Or maybe Raine and Red going out for a meal.
"Why not both?" - Something one of the two may ask.
But it'd be easier for Tom
And then troll Tom kicks in and has them eating while dancing.
The thing is though, when I was reading through the comments of 'Halfkind Kiss' and 'Christmas Tail Fail' there was someone who...VEHEMENTLY...hated Red.
As in...well, I will quote them from the Deviantart comments of 'Halfkind Kiss'...
"I anti-ship Red. I want him to die alone."
Which...makes me feel a bit nervous
Does that person say anything for any other sketch with Red?
I understand why some people might dislike Red.
Heck, I didn't start warming up to him till Chapter 17
But someone vehemently insisting that a character is incorrigble like that...I know I am a little hostile to Clovis, but I understand why some people like Clovis pics for example
So why not Red pics too? In my opinion, he doesn't get enough credit.
Gotta give that guy points for at least TRYING to change his outlook.,
"He's trying ffs, give him 10 to 50 years."
That's kinda why I like him
I see a lot of myself in him.
Kinda an asshole...but able to change.
"And if he doesn't turn around by then. Then you can kill him."
Isn't that one of the core themes of the comic? Bad people changing for the better?

Congratulations, you convinced me to play Bloodborne again.
Lo, I take it that game works a lot better in terms of PvP?

I'm enjoying DS2.  While there were definitely the fair share of kindergarden grade boss fights, the DLC areas are proving much harder.  Now only if I would stop running into the same "mob = difficulty" design everywhere...
Nah, almost non-existent pvp. I just prefer it over the DS games.
Dark Souls 2 has some well documented questionable design decisions
Like tying the time it takes to use items, or the iFrames on rolls / backsteps to a stat
The Soul Memory mechanic, which creates a horde more problems than it solves, and the lackluster early boss fights

Right now though, Soul Memory is what's killing me.  Every time I die and lose 40 - 60k souls, that's 40 - 60k souls added to my SM count that I didn't even get to use.  And a lot of tiers are defined by a 100k range.
Do that enough times, and I'm bumped up to way higher tiers than I could've been for my progress.
